claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A CONSORT flow diagram showing participant enrollment, randomization, and follow-up visits over two flu seasons (2018–2019 and 2019–2020) for four vaccine arms: cell culture–based IIV4 (ccIIV4), recombinant HA vaccine (RIV4), and two egg-based IIV4 vaccines (Fluzone IIV4 and Fluarix IIV4). It details numbers enrolled, age strata, completions at day 0, 1 month, and 6 months, and re-randomization in Year 2. The figure does not present any data or statements about mutations arising during vaccine production or their impact on effectiveness, so it does not support the claim.

It details numbers enrolled, age strata, completions at day 0, 1 month, and 6 months, and re-randomization in Year 2.
